definition: to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap

sentences.english: The kidnappers levied a ransom on the child's parents.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪向小孩的父母索取赎金。

sentences.english: The kidnapper is yulia tutor, see his jump off a building suicide.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪是尤丽亚的家教老师，见事情败露便跳楼自尽。

sentences.english: A kidnapper poured one or two kilogram kerosene on the floor from a kettle.
sentences.chinese: 一个绑匪从一个水壶里倒了一两公斤的煤油在地上。

sentences.english: It might give future kidnappers some leverage.
sentences.chinese: 这可能会给以后的绑匪一些提示。

sentences.english: The militant has been the policeman tackled, children safe from danger.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪已经被警察擒获，孩子们安全脱险了。

sentences.english: Then several entpirical policemen began to search the kidnappers and the boy.
sentences.chinese: 然后几名凭经验的警察开始搜查绑匪和男孩。

sentences.english: The announcement came a day after Sudanese troops killed six of the hostage-takers in a shootout.
sentences.chinese: 一天前，苏丹军队在枪战中打死了6名绑匪。

sentences.english: The kidnappers said that they think is the agent Romanova.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪说，他们认为罗曼诺娃是特工。

sentences.english: One by one, all the kidnappers were knocked out.
sentences.chinese: 一个接一个，所有的绑匪都被击倒了。
我们将对绑匪的绑票行为予以打击。

sentences.english: The sad gangsters said that they would not do it henceforth.
sentences.chinese: 沮丧的绑匪说他们今后再也不干这种事了。

sentences.english: Kidnappers have been captured by the police, the children a safe escape.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪已经被警察擒获，孩子们安全脱险了。

sentences.english: Blackmailers , as well as kidnappers, face substantial credibility problems.
sentences.chinese: 勒索者，与绑匪一样要面对真实的诚信问题。

sentences.english: The Police hurried to untangle the remaining children barred by the abductor.
sentences.chinese: 警方赶紧把被绑匪关着的剩下的那个孩子解救了出来。

sentences.english: New age travelers kidnap the prized dog of a Bristol Antiques dealer, with dire consequences.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪绑架了古董商的名贵狗，但却引来了可怕的后果。

definition: lit. to tear the ticket/to kill a hostage (usually held for ransom)
